content.rendered:
Muktinath tour package takes you to one of the holiest and one of the most sacred homes of the lord of Justice or Muktinath, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. It is said that people who make the Char Dham Yatra and miss out on visiting Muktinath Dham then their Chardham remains incomplete.

This holy temple is located at an elevation of 3,710 meters above sea level amongst a surreal landscape. We present to you some of the most amazing collections of Muktinath tour packages in Nepal that are customizable as per your wish at the most reasonable prices.

Located across the magnificent valley of Mustang the temple is not only of importance in Hinduism but is also a significant place of worship for Buddhists as well. The package not only consists of Muktinath Darshan but also guarantees a complete exploration and sightseeing of Nepal. This will allow you to have a complete and wholesome pilgrimage via helicopter or by road. From Kathmandu and Pokhara to Jomsom and other relevant Nepalese destinations, we guarantee a spiritual experience for all. The temple remains open for the entire year and makes sure to accept visitors throughout so what are you waiting for? Book your choice of tour package of Muktinath right now.

FAQs for Muktinath Packages

Q. How Many People Can The Helicopter Carry?

A. The helicopter is designed to accommodate only five to six people at a time to Muktinath. It will be really expensive if you are planning on chartering the whole helicopter for just 2 or 3 people but you can minimize this by choosing to go on a Yatra journey with 5 to 6 people when the expenditure cost is divided evenly.

Q. What Are The Best Months For Visiting Muktinath?

A. The months of March, April, May, June, September, October and November are the only times in the entire year when the skies are clear and the weather is pleasant for you to visit this Dham. The best part will be that during the said months while going on a helicopter journey you will be able to view the magnificent snow-capped surroundings.

Q. What Are The Necessary Permits Required For This Journey?

A. The temple lies within the trekking and conservation zone of Nepal and for this purpose 2 main permits are required which are - Annapurna Conservation Area Project Permit or ACAP and the other one is Trekker’s Information Management System Permit or TIMS. Entering this zone without these two permits is considered an offence and you will not be allowed to enter this region without it. If you avail a package all the permits requirements will be taken care of.

Q. Is It Possible To Visit Pokhara Instead Of Making My Way Back To Kathmandu?

A. Yes, it is possible for you to make your way to Pokhara and spend a few days there as well before heading back to Kathmandu since it fall en route the helicopter journey. From Pokhara you can make your way back Kathmandu easily via a tourist bus, cab or taxi. By road the journey takes around 7.5 hours.

Q. Why Do People Visit Muktinath?

A. People generally visit this 5th Dham of India since it holds immense significance in the lives of devout Hindus. Here Vishnu Ji is worshipped as - Muktinath - or the god of salvation. People come here to take a holy bath under the chilled water flowing through the 108 spouts since it is believed that doing so will free them from all the sins that they have committed in their entire life. So in short, visiting Muktinath is said to bring salvation to devout pilgrims.

Q. How Much Time Will The Helicopter Take To Complete The Journey?

A. From Kathmandu the temple is located at a flying distance of just 1.5 hours and 45 minutes from Pokhara. A helicopter package will allow you to complete your Darshan in duration of 1 hour. From the helipad the temple is situated at a distance of just half an hour which can also be covered via a horse or a Palki or even a Doli ride.
